SEDULA
Six female singers joined to form Sedula in 1994. The ensemble focuses mostly on vocal folk music, its creative interpretation and post-folk transformation, with a subtle accompaniment of kanklÃƒâ€žÃ¢â‚¬â€s (the Lithuanian type of zither), violins, skuduÃƒâ€žÃ‚ï¿½iai (multi-pipe whistles), percussion and other instruments. Interpretations of Sedula are remarkable for their idiosyncratic, transparent and spellbindingly undulating sound of womenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s voices. On stage they wear beautiful costumes recreated after the 15th-16th c. examples.
